00002   * @file

00004   * IRQ-Coalescing and Data Statistics Counters FAQ.

00007 /**
00008  
00009 @page IRQ_Coalescing_Counters IRQ-Coalescing and Data Statistics Counters 
00010 
00011 @section contents Contents
00012 
00013     - @ref Interrupt_coalesing
00014     - @ref default_value
00015     - @ref enable_interrupt_coalescing
00016     - @ref run_time_value
00017     - @ref stat_counter
00018     - @ref enable_data_counter
00019     - @ref view_data_counter
00020     - @ref reset_data_counter
00021 
00022 
00023 @section Interrupt_coalesing 1. What is Interrupt Coalescing? 
00024 
00025 Interrupt Coalescing is the feature of hardware to interrupt only after
00026 preset number of completed commands or preset timer value or whichever
00027 is earlier.
00028 <br><br>
00029 
00030 
00031 @section default_value 2. How to change the default values of Interrupt Counter and Timer?
00032 
00033 Interrupt Counter and Timer value can be set by defining the value
00034 of following identifiers in ./cavium/software/driver/osi/interrupt.h
00035 
00036 GENINT_COUNT_THOLD (Interrupt Counter Threshold)
00037 default value is 10
00038 
00039 GENINT_COUNT_INT_TIME (Timer Threshold)
00040 default values is 400000000.
00041 (Note: For Nitrox PX, timer value is in clock cycles.
00042        400000000 clock cycles = 1 second)
00043 <br><br>
00044 
00045 
00046 @section enable_interrupt_coalescing 3. How to enable Interrupt Coalescing?
00047 
00048 This feature can be enabled by defining INTERRUPT_COALESCING flag
00049 cavium/software/driver/osi/cavium.h file.
00050 <br><br>
00051 
00052 
00053 @section run_time_value 4. How to see the run time values of Interrupt Counter and Timer?
00054 These values can be viewed at run time through proc interface by
00055 reading the file ->/proc/cavium/regs
00056 The following entries in the file indicate the respective dynamic values:
00057 
00058 Interrupt Counter Threshold Register
00059 Interrupt Timer Threshold Register
00060 Interrupt Counter Register
00061 Interrupt Timer Register
00062 
00063 Note: If these entries are not found, then Interrupt Coalescing is
00064       not enabled in the loaded Nitrox driver.
00065 <br><br>
00066 
00067 
00068 @section stat_counter 5. What are Data Statistics Counters?
00069 
00070 These are various data statistics of Incoming Requests to the Nitrox.
00071 Currenty SSL Record Processing, IPSEC Inbound/Outbound Processing, Genral
00072 Crypto Processing, HMAC requests are supported.
00073 Data statistics are: Packet Requests, Packet Aborts, Bytes In, Bytes Out.
00074 <br><br>
00075 
00076 
00077 @section enable_data_counter 6. How to enable Data Statistics Counters?
00078 This feature can be enabled and disabled through Makefile.Linux of Nitrox
00079 driver by setting the flag COUNTER to the value as indicated.
00080 <br><br>
00081 
00082 
00083 @section view_data_counter 7. How to view Data Statistics Counters?
00084 
00085 Data counters can be viewed through proc interface by reading the
00086 file ->/proc/cavium/data_stats.
00087 <br><br>
00088 
00089 
00090 @section reset_data_counter 8. How to reset Data Statistics Counters?
00091 
00092 Data counters can be reset by writing 1 to /proc/cavium/data_stats_reset.
00093 <br><br>
00094 
00095 
00096 */
